sidebyside.p: ABCD is a rectangle. The diagonals of a rectangle bisect each other. In the figure, \angle AQD = 130\degree. Find the angles labeled 1 through 5 in order, and give a reason for each answer.

answer.p: \angle 1 = 130\degree because vertical angles are equal. \angle 2 = 50\degree because it makes a straight angle with a 130\degree angle. \angle 3 = 65\degree because it is a base angle of an isosceles triangle whose vertex angle is 50\degree. \angle 4 = 65\degree for the same reason. \angle 5 = 25\degree because it is complementary to \angle 4.
